awd_titl_txt: Pressure Tuning Spectroscopic Studies of Intervalence       Transition Bands
awd_abstract_narration: This Research Opportunities for Women Career Advancement Award                  is in the general area of inorganic chemistry.  Dr. Nita A.                     Lewis of the Chemistry Department of the University of Miami                    will study electron transfer in diferrocenes and                                4,4'-bipyridine-bridged ruthenium complexes under high pressure                 conditions.  Because the intervalence charge transfer band of                   these species is solvent dependent, it is expected that high                    pressure measurements could yield information on the role of                    the solvent in electron transfer reactions.  Two graduate                       students will participate in the project.  Dr. Lewis has                        recently begun high pressure studies and this award will assist                 her in pursuing her goal of establishing a laboratory for high                  pressure research in inorganic chemistry in the United States.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
